text: Alexander von Volborth/Aleksandr Fedorovich von Volborth (born 1800, Mogilev - died 1876, Kiev), was a Russian palaeontologist. Volborthite, a mineral containing copper and vanadium and first found in 1838 at the Sofronovskii Copper Mine near Perm in the Urals, was named after him.http://www.mindat.org/min-4200.html ==References== Category:1800 births Category:1876 deaths Category:Russian paleontologists
title: Alexander von Volborth
